sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a televised speech to the UN General Assembly, Ukraine's President Zelensky slams Moscow's decision to mobilize more troops and says Russia must be punished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 1,300 people were arrested across Russia on Wednesday in demonstrations against the mobilization of reservist troops ordered by President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Protesters in Iran continue to condemn the death of Massa Amini, who died in the Morality Police custody, and call for President Raisi to be prosecuted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A standing ovation for Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky at the UN General Assembly in New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In his speech, the wartime president said Moscow's decision to partly mobilize some reservists shows that Russia is not interested in negotiating an end to the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine wants peace. Europe wants peace. The world wants peace. And we have seen who is the only one who wants war. There is only one entity among all UN member states who would say now, if he could interrupt my speech, that he is happy with this war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With his war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A special tribunal should be created to punish Russia for the crime of aggressor against our state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This will become signal to all would-be aggressors that they must value peace or be brought to responsibility by the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Kyiv has announced the biggest prisoner swap between the warring sides since the beginning of the invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine released 55 of Putin's allies, and in exchange, Moscow returned 215 imprisoned soldiers, including five military commanders and leaders from Mariupol's Azovstal regiment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Back in Moscow, President Vladimir Putin defended the invasion of Ukraine and the drafting of many citizens at a ceremony commemorating the 1160th anniversary of Russian statehood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Being a patriot is the essence of the nature and character of the Russian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now, in the course of a special military operation, our heroes, soldiers, officers and volunteers are demonstrating precisely the highest human qualities, fighting bravely shoulder to shoulder, like brothers, for the sake of saving the people of the Donbas, for the sake of their native country, which will always be only free and independent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Decision to call 300,000 reservists to join the fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This comes as Putin also suggested he will use nuclear weapons if Russia is threatened.

sentences.sentence: More than 1,300 people were arrested across Russia on Tuesday in demonstrations against

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: the mobilization ordered by President Vladimir Putin. Most of the arrests took place in St.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Petersburg, where police used a heavy-handed approach to suppress protesters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Also in the capital Moscow more than 500 people were arrested by police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On the streets there is outrage but also fear.

sentences.sentence: The mobilization is horrible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Most of the normal people do not support it but they are afraid to protest because they can be arrested.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Similar images of arrests have been seen all over the country. And the fear of mobilization and the possibility of being sent to the front line has led many to flee Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Shortly after the mobilization was announced, tickets to travel to countries where Russians don't need a visa, like here in Armenia, saw a huge surge in price and only the fastest to act were able to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I wouldn't call it panic. A scenario like this one has been imagined. The tickets didn't cost too much as I was probably quick enough and we got through the border just fine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Simply passed and flew away. Yes, this is an unscheduled visit. I'm 17 and I haven't had a letter from the recruitment office yet, but I'm studying online, which can be disputed. So we left.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the face of a flood of combat aid, Russians fleeing the country, many European countries are looking at a ban on tourist visas for Russian nationals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The decision by Russian President Vladimir Putin to curl up thousands of extra troops to fight the war in Ukraine has provoked a swift reaction from the EU. The EU foreign policy chief has promised more sanctions over Moscow's escalation of the conflict. Additional restrictive measures against Russia will be brought forward immediately, as soon as possible, in coordination with our partners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And I want to stress in particular one important element.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In line with the United Nations Charter and international law, In line with the United Nations Charter and international law, Ukraine is exercising its legitimate right to defend itself against the Russian aggression to regain full control of its territory and has the right to liberate occupied territories within its internationally recognized borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: within its internationally recognized borders and for that we will continue supporting Ukraine's efforts to provision of military equipment as long as it takes the partial mobilization order comes two days before Russian controlled regions in eastern and southern Ukraine plan to hold referendums on becoming part of Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The energy crisis and climate change are pushing the European community to find solutions to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: reach decarbonisation targets by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The University of Sannio in southern Italy, in collaboration with the consortium of research bodies and private companies, is going towards this direction fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's not only a student house, but also a living lab where for the first time in Europe a micropower unit of pure hydrogen based fuel cells has been implemented in an actual construction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: cells has been implemented in an actual construction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After working for years on energy well-being and savings for the environment, we have focused on the issue of CO2 emissions in the environment and worked on the idea of using hydrogen to make this house a completely self-sufficient system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It looks like a normal house, everything is working as it should and students here have all they need to feel comfortable, but in fact this is not a regular house, in the sense that this building is powered by hydrogen fuel cells, an actual experiment that is taking us into the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Right now we are in the HZ Living Lab of the University of Sarnia of Benevento, which is I am able to balance my personal life with the research activity in my study course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In her recent State of the Union speech, the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, announced the creation of the European Hydrogen Bank that would invest up to 3 billion euros on hydrogen.
